climbs.name: I Felt A Clear Light Coming Through

content.description:
A super enjoyable boulder problem, though topping out does put you up pretty high. Use a thin hand jam for your left and stay on the face as you reach up for the amazing ledge, and throw for the top.



Look at the large wall on the right side of the landing, before the wall curves around the corner.

A really fun area for bouldering and traversing if you're looking for a day out solo. Some of the cracks are alright to lead as well. Very infrequently climbed at.

There is a wonderful 35-40m traverse running the length of this wall. You are never more than a foot or two above the ground, and no mats needed. No move is over V1, but it's really enjoyable to practice technical and efficient movement, or do some endurance training.
